## What is R Café?

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
-   R users at UMass Chan Medical School
-   Meet monthly (online or in-person)
-   Share skills and cool projects, troubleshoot code, ask questions
-   Started June 2022
-   16 gatherings so far (attendance 31-6, median of 9 people)
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}
![](https://libapps.s3.amazonaws.com/customers/3713/images/R_Cafe_logo.png){fig-alt="R Café logo"}
:::
:::

## Topics covered

::: columns
::: column
-   Creating slides in R
-   Intro to R
-   Intro to Tidyverse
-   Intro to Shiny
-   Visualizations with ggplot2
-   REDCap API with R
-   For loops and loop-like functions
:::

::: column
-   R/Medicine highlights
-   Custom functions, keeping code DRY
-   R features that we're thankful for
-   Stack Overflow, reproducible workflow, debugging
-   Lubridate and faceting
-   R project demos
:::
:::

## How did the partnership come about?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Ben toured the library
-   Joint interest in promoting R coding
-   Shared experience teaching R and research reproducibility
:::

## Ben, what were you looking for from the library?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Interested in institutional and data repositories, NIH grant requirements
-   Stability and structure
    -   Existing connections and broader view (outside department)
-   Knowledge of electronic resources and administering access
-   Centralized location
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/research_cycle.png){fig-alt="Research cycle: Plan and design; Collect and capture; Collaborate and analyse; Manage, store, and preserve; Share and publish; Discover, Reuse, & Cite"}
:::
:::

## Ben, what did the library bring to the partnership?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Existing Github repository
-   Tess knew resources, workflow, marketing channels, and event coordination
-   Administered DataCamp access
-   Teaching experience (recording, running Zoom, video editing)
-   Centralized virtual location for materials

## What takeaways would you share from the collaboration?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Good communication with check-ins before/after gatherings
-   Centralized materials and outputs
-   Being flexible:
    -   In-person --\> Online
    -   Quarterly --\> Monthly
    -   Giving time for people to do their own coding --\> All demo and questions
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/umass_chan_zoom.png){fig-alt="Students using Zoom at UMass Chan"}
:::
:::

## Tess, what are your tips for partnering with the research community?

-   Find out what form of communication works best for the researcher(s)
-   Administrators are your friends
-   Plan for meetings in advance

## Ben, what advice would you give librarians for working with researchers?

-   Communication
    -   Be proactive in anticipating needs and follow up
    -   Brief communications preferable to long meetings
-   Provide structure
    -   Centralized resources
    -   Regular meeting times
-   Find common interest
    -   Passion for training students and trainees
    -   Innovation and creativity

## Ben, what would you tell your colleagues about working with the library?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Lucky to have a wonderful library (with wonderful librarians)
-   Librarians up to date on policies (e.g., data sharing)
-   Colleagues under-utilize (don't know library resources)
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/nih_data_sharing_policy.png){fig-alt="NIH Data Sharing Policy"}
